description: In 1850 from Muscovy glass  +â€Ž -ite, from the province Muscovy in Russia. Named by James Dwight Dana.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A pale brown mineral of the mica group, being a basic potassium aluminosilicate with the chemical formula KAl2(Si3Al)O10(OH,F)2; used as an electrical insulator etc.
